basics.name: Daniel Leibold
basics.label: Tech Lead & Product Engineer
basics.summary: I'm an enthusiastic and product focused engineer with a strong sense for teamplay. I like TDD and ATDD to favour outcome over output. I'm generally very flexible when investigating new roles.

education.institution: The University of Applied Sciences in Osnabrück

references.reference: Requirements means 'shut up' aka. user story mapping. Outcome vs. Output. see <https://youtu.be/AorAgSrHjKM?feature=shared&t=2000>
references.name: Jeff Patton

references.reference: Measuring developer productivity? A response to McKinsey. see <https://newsletter.pragmaticengineer.com/p/measuring-developer-productivity>
references.name: Kent Beck

certificates.name: Certified Project Specialist according to IPMA 3.0

publications.name: Testing with VS2012. 'From Dogma to Karma'.
publications.summary: Writing an article about TDD with my former colleague Christoph Molenda.

work.summary: Developer/Evangelist in a cross-functional team (PO, Infrastructure & Security Engineer, Dev, 9 people) that provides platform products as self-services for developers (IDP). “Platform as a Product“-Mindset following Team Topologies. Facilitation of the user experience for the platform services (change of perspective, developer experience (DevEx)). Leading user interviews and gaining insights (qualitative and quantitative) to improve the product.
work.name: PricewaterhouseCoopers GmbH Wirtschaftsprüfungsgesellschaft
highlights: Grand total of 3.8mio EUR in 18 month with our services
Central Self-Service UI based on Flask
Used Figma for design and UX work of landing page and Hotjar and Piwik for user tracking
Member of Security Triad, Deputy Security Champion
Technical enablement of GitLab Ultimate SaaS for 1400 users in PwC DE
Community Call Ambassador (60+ recordings of knowledge)
Design and Build new Container Service in context of global enterprise

work.summary: Azure DevOps Automation Engineer in an agile product team (7 people). Cloud-native product development on MS Azure (PaaS) via ARM Templates, PowerShell and C#. Facilitator of agile practices and principles through servant leadership.
work.name: PwC IT Services GmbH
highlights: Role Model for Product Development (be the first of everything)
Stream aligned Product Team
Product Development with CI/CD & Azure DevOps

work.summary: Senior consultant, architect and developer in the field of portals and collaboration for the integration of Microsoft technologies into corporate enterprises. Leading, conducting and recording requirements workshops for the customer department with formal or informal methodology. Responsible for the development of Microsoft solutions for customers using Visual Studio and TFS Online.
work.name: ConVista Consulting AG
highlights: Agile team leadership during implementation in the role of Scrum Master and Agile Coach
Technical Lead Developer for client projects

work.summary: Architect and developer in the field of Microsoft technologies.
work.name: MT AG
highlights: Design and test-driven development (TDD) of a WCF Data Access Layer to provide data from an Oracle 10g database in a multi-layer architecture
Creation of best practices and C# coding style guides within the department

work.summary: .NET Developer and consultant. Development of various SharePoint portal solutions for internal business processes and workflows. Expert in the field of dynamic provisioning of SharePoint farms in enterprise companies (private cloud).
work.name: Computa Center
highlights: Turn a PKI script collection into a web based (internal) Product for enrolling certificates automatically
Publish articles on Windows Developer

work.summary: Software Engineer responsible for a distributed system for mass data processing (200-500 users worldwide). Configuration manager for different development lines. Technical expert and 'in-house' technology consultant in the field of data evaluation and data preparation. Collaborate with internal customers. Requirements analysis. Multitier and client – server programming.
work.name: Rosen
highlights: Early adopter of modern software development practices
Unit-Testing & TDD using NUnit and .NET
Continuous Integration with CruiseControl.NET
Distributed system for mass data processing (200-500 users worldwide)

interests.name: Family
keywords: My wife and my two kids
